intro: Saurauia cuchumatanensis, commonly known as the Cuchumatán wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the highland regions of Central America, particularly in Guatemala and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
